name: WP Marktplaats
author: Stefan Verstege

sections.description: Nice dutch targeted plugin which enables your to show the products your are trying to sell on http://www.marktplaats.nl on your own blog!
sections.installation:
Complete installation guide can be found on: http://projects.newmedia.nl/projects/wpmarktplaats/wiki

Follow the next steps to set the plugin up for your own usage.

Get the plugin from one of the following places:

Download the tarball from here: http://projects.newmedia.nl/projects/wpmarktplaats/files or from the wordpress plugin repository.

Or you can run ‘on-the-edge’ code using our mercurial repository: hg clone http://hg.newmedia.nl/wp_marktplaats

Using the widget

Now it’s time to add the widget to your blog sidebar

  1. Go to the admin section of your wordpress blog
  2. Select the sidebar where you want to install the plugin
  3. Click on ‘add’ on the wp_marktplaats widget bar to add it to the selected sidebar
  4. If needed, you can ‘drag and drop’ it to an other place in the widget list Now we can configure the widget

Configure the widget

When the widget is in the sidebar, click on the ‘edit’ link of the widget, now you can change several things: * Widget title (widget title): This the text presented above the widget on your blog * Gebruikerscode (usercode): Your unique id on marktplaats. See [[how to get your id]] to get this * Aantal advertenties (amount of ads): The amount of adverts you want to show maximal per page

Press ‘done’ when ready. Press ‘save changes’ to make wordpress remember the changes you made.
sections.changelog: 0.6.0 – Now RSS or HTML scraping can be used (thnx hklok) 0.5.2 – Fixed some minor bugs 0.5.0 – Initial (beta) release
